item.title: Singapore | Dissolved Parliament paves the way to general elections
item.description: The Parliament of Singapore has been dissolved, paving the way for general elections in which the Popular Action Party (PAP), which has long ruled the country, will try to strengthen its dominion, under the command of Prime Minister Lawrence Wong. The Electoral Department set May 3 as a date for the elections. The victory has been practically guaranteed to PAP, which leads Singapore since its independence in 1965. Wong, who took office as Singapore's fourth leader in May last year, wants to win a more robust victory after the PAP has suffered a setback in the 2020 elections due to the growing discontent of voters with the government. Wong succeeded Lee Hsien Loong, who resigned after two decades in charge of the country. Lee's departure marked the end of a family dynasty began by his father, Lee Kuan Yew, the first Singapore leader who turned the island into one of the richest nations in the world during his 31st years. In the 2020 elections, held during the Covid-19 pandemic, PAP maintained the absolute majority, with 83 of the 93 parliamentary seats, but lost places for the opposition, which increased parliamentary representation from six to 10, the largest ever registered.

item.title: Sam Hou fai fear deficit but will review budget to reinforce support
item.description:
The new Macao government leader admitted yesterday to fear a deficit in 2025, due to the slowdown in the game's recipes, but reiterated that he will review the region's budget to reinforce social support. "I am worried, if game revenues only reach 15 billion [of patacas per month], it may result in a budget deficit," Sam Hou Fai told the deputies. It is recalled that Ho Iat Seng had predicted game revenues of 240 billion patacas by 2025, or 20 billion per month. But in the first three months of the year, Macao casinos registered total revenues of 57.7 billion patacas, below the Government target, despite an increase of 0.6 percent compared to the same period of 2024. “We have to have a feeling of risk,” warned Sam Hou Fai, during the debate on the Government Action Lines (LAG) to 2025, in the Legislative Assembly. Basic law requires public accounts to remain on positive land. The government leader recalled that China - by far the main source of tourists to Macau - fell into deflation (annual fall of consumer prices) in March for the second consecutive month, "but savings increased." Sam Hou Fai argued that these data show that the Chinese population also has "a feeling of risk", which was already before the new US president, Donald Trump, start a trade war with China.
Size is relative On Monday, at the press conference after the LAG presentation, the chief executive admitted that Trump's tariffs will have a "more indirect" impact on Macao. Sam Hou Fai pointed out as probable consequences the decrease, both of the consumption of local families and a break in the number of visitors and consumption, especially in case of devaluation of the Renmimbi. Still, the government leader guaranteed yesterday that he will review the budget to 2025, prepared by the predecessor, for measures such as the creation of a fund, worth 10 billion patacas, to support small and medium enterprises. Sam Hou Fai admitted that current expenses, social support and public function, "will only increase, not decrease," but preferred to focus on the diversification of public revenues. In the first two months of 2025, taxes on the game represented 89.3 percent of Macao government current revenues.

item.title: Beijing, Hong Kong and Macau accuse the US of attacking China's survival
item.description: The Chinese Communist Party's main official for Hong Kong and Macao affairs and governments of both regions yesterday accused the United States of imposing tariffs to sabotage China. "The US has targeted our tariffs, they target our own survival," said Xia Baolong, director of the Hong Kong and Macau affairs, under the tutelage of the State Council. "Although Hong Kong is the largest source of US commercial surplus, the United States still imposed high tariffs. This is extremely arrogant and blatant," said Xia. "The US cannot tolerate Hong Kong's prosperity and stability and are the biggest sinister manipulator that undermines human rights, freedom, the rule of law, prosperity and stability in Hong Kong," the leader added. Xia spoke in a pre-recorded speech, transmitted during the inauguration of an exhibition in Hong Kong, regarding the Day of National Security Education. “Quem tente levar-nos de volta à pobreza e à fraqueza é nosso inimigo”, alertou o dirigente. “Aqueles que traem os interesses nacionais e torcem pelo inimigo em momentos críticos nunca serão tolerados”, acrescentou. Chief Words Today, at the same ceremony, Hong Kong's government leader John Lee Ka-Chiu accused the United States of, in a "wicked logic," imposing tariffs to protect his "unhealthy hegemony." "The United States oppose free trade, interrupt global trade and supply chains (…), severely damaging the multilateral trade system and the process of globalization," said John Lee. The chief executive has assured that Hong Kong "will keep his status from Porto Franco with basically null fares" and will file a complaint against the United States to the World Trade Organization. Also the leader of the Macao government yesterday criticized the United States for the "abusive imposition of customs taxes on all its business partners," including China, "under several pretexts." Also during the inauguration of an exhibition due to National Security Education Day, Sam Hou Fai said Washington "severely devastated the multilateral trade system (...) and impaired the stability of the world economic order."

item.title: GP | Touring cars finding begins with greater presence Macaense
item.description:

For this race, which will serve as qualification for the 72nd Macao Grand Prix, will be on the starting grid a dozen Macau pilots, including five Portuguese names

Premium Racing Team driver had, in the last Macao Grand Prix, one of the fastest in terms of tip speed in the platoon of his race. Back is also Jerónimo Badaraco (Toyota Gr86), a pilot who, in the Macao Grand Prix last year, reached second place at Macao Road Sport Challenge. After having been modest in the finding events, “Noni” was very strong in the city streets, where he was the best Macaense pilot, in a race won by law Kit Meng. Bringing with him a nickname with a huge tradition in Macao's motorsport, the young Maximiano, who competed for several years in the local Karting events and, in 2022, participated in a Formula 4 Chinese Championship race, will make his debut at Macau Road Sport Challenge with a Toyota GR86. The Macanese presence will be reinforced by Dionísio Albino Pereira, a pilot regularly seen in the coloane Karting events, which will conduct a Toyota GR86 from LW World Racing Team. In 2013, he competed in the Macao - Macau Touring Car Series Tourism Championship, then driving a Honda Integra DC5 from the Pas Macau Racing Team team. The representation of the territory in these findings will also feature Chi Wang, Carson Tang, IP Tok Meng, Chan Chi Ha, Lo Kai Tin and Lou Check In. It will be to hurt In 2024, the Macao-China General Automotive Association (AAMC) was able to place all the drivers of the Macau Tourism Championship in the end of the Grand Prix. This year, it seems that the scenario of organizing two races for local pilots will be impossible. As such, these qualifying races will have a much higher impact, and only half of those now registered will have entry ticket for the largest annual sports event of MSAR. Another novelty for this year is that all cars will be equipped with tires of the Italian brand Pirelli, as had already happened in the Grand Prix. However, this year there will be a new compound, the same for everyone, which may shuffle the favorite accounts. Centralins will continue to be drawn, as in the past. Since the number of participants is high, AAMC will divide the pilots into groups A and B, not two but four races in total. Each race will have 15 laps, two of which will be played on Saturday and two on Sunday.

item.title: Security | Sam points to the US and asks for preparation for the worst scenario
item.description:
Given the “abusive imposition of customs taxes”, Sam Hou Fai asked the population union in the efforts to develop national security in all areas, including the next September legislative elections
The chief executive wants the population of Macau to be united to meet the “abusive imposition of customs taxes” from the United States of America (US). The request was left yesterday by Sam Hou Fai, during the inauguration speech of the exhibition on national security education. "The US recently announced the abusive imposition of customs taxes on all its business partners, including our country, under several pretexts, which severely devastated the multilateral trade system that has as its core the World Trade Organization, and impaired the stability of the world economic order," he began to state the political leader of the MGre. From the perspective of the Chief Executive, these changes have created a "drastically altered external environment and with increasingly complex and severe challenges and challenges." Therefore, Sam Hou Fai asked the population to understand the “importance of general security”: “In addition to further reinforcing the confidence that our great homeland will lead the whole Chinese people to overcome challenges and difficulties, we must profoundly understand the importance of general security, firmly apply the general perspective of national security and continue to promote the construction of the system, the mechanism and legal regime of Macao to safeguard national security”, he said. All in the same sense Sam Hou Fai intends that the defense of national security will be practiced in all fields of society: “We must make all efforts in the development of MSAR, the political, economic, social, among others, and in external relations, to perform our work well,” he said. "We also have to increase our awareness of risks, persist in a prudent surveillance attitude to control and prevent any emergencies and be prepared for the worst scenarios, mitigating the different types of risks and challenges, namely interference and infiltration of external forces, which we have to prevent and repress resolutely," he added. The chief executive also highlighted this year's elections to the Legislative Assembly as a time when the national defense should be safeguarded, to "guarantee peace and lasting social stability in Macao." In yesterday's speech, Sam Hou Fai also made the apology for the defense of social harmony and stability as one of the main tasks attributed by Xi Jinping to Mand. The ruler recalled that the “three expectations” left by Xi, when passing through Macao in December, “focus efforts to maintain harmony and social stability”, “be alert and knowing how to protect against potential dangers, know how to prevent the national security and stability of Macau firmly and to“ value peace and stability ”while strengthening“ economic growth and the economic growth and the economic growth and the economic growth and the economic growth and the economic growth and the economic growth development".

item.title: LAG 2025 | Government wants to create an integrated vocational training platform
item.description:
In the debate on the government lines for this year, the Chief Executive highlighted the initiative to create an “integrated vocational training platform” for young people who have difficulty finding their first job. Of the 7,100 unemployed, about 4,000 are young people, said the ruler
There is structural unemployment in Macao and this is “notorious”. Representative NGAN Iek Hang raised the issue in yesterday's debate about the Government Action Lines (LAG) report and demanded concrete measures to the government. "Many young people have difficulty finding work in their area of ​​specialization, and many residents have tightened their belt and have been more prudent in spending. How will I improve employment support with a multidimensional approach, ensuring the use of residents?" Sam Hou Fai, in his narrow as chief executive to present the lag and discuss them with the deputies, announced the creation of an “integrated vocational training platform” that includes government secretariats, local associations and companies to make specific courses depending on the needs of the business environment. “Currently, the unemployment rate is 2.4 percent, about 7,100 unemployed, and four thousand are young. It is a structural unemployment and is a situation that has emerged in the last two years. There are many specific courses finalists, such as medicine, which cannot find employment. For areas, ”he said. Sam Hou Fai also added that the proposal came from the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP. "We also have to rely on the secretary's protection O LAM [Social Affairs and Culture], because it also has to do with education. Regarding the accreditation and professional certification, it is necessary to count on government participation, associations and companies, and the next stage is to create this integrated platform taking into account the experiences of neighboring territories," he said. Attention to satellite casinos Sam Hou Fai also recalled the unemployment resulting from the possible closure of satellite casinos as an example of the need for specific courses depending on the needs of the local economy. "Regarding the satellite casinos, we will have to see in two or three months to know the needs of the unemployed and then we can organize specific actions for certain areas," he explained. The objective of the future integrated training platform is to “solve the problem of human resources”, given that hiring non-resident workers “is just a supplementary support measure that will be changed taking into account the transformation of Macau and its concrete situation”. The Chief Executive recalled the training actions that already exist between the Macao Workers' Federation of the Federation of Associations and the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs, as well as the game operators. "We have to take into account the 1+4 diversification strategy and create courses that give diplomas. We have to rely on companies to combine efforts," he concluded.

item.title: Rui Cunha Foundation hosts book launch on buildings life
item.description: The Docomomo Macau Research Center has launched an invitation to present the book “How to Extend Buildings Life”, which results from a Macao Docomomo investigation into the most significant examples of twentieth -century modern architecture. The event is scheduled for April 23, at 6.30 pm, at the Rui Cunha Foundation and will be attended by architects Cecilia Chu, Bernard Brennan and Rui Leão, in a conversation moderate by Francisco Ricarte. According to the organizers, the will be “aiming to lead the importance of modern movement to public attention, authorities, professionals and the educational community concerned with the built environment, and promote the development of adequate conservation techniques and methods and disseminate this knowledge among the professions”. Throughout the conversation it will also be addressed the conservation of architectural heritage, which, according to the organizers, has as its background the increasingly intense threats. "In recent decades, the architectural heritage of the last century seemed more threatened than in any other period. This is mainly due to the fact that many of these masterpieces are not considered elements of heritage, their original functions changed substantially and their technological innovations did not always resist long-term tensions," he was communicated. "Once functional use can change over time, well -designed buildings are able to adapt to new types of use and prolong their usefulness when their durability goes beyond the role of their original tenant," he was added. Intervention voices Regarding speakers, Cecilia Chu is an associate professor at the School of Architecture at the Chinese University of Hong Kong, graduated in Urban History and with experience in design and conservation. Bernard Brennan is an associate of Wilkinson Eyre and assistant professor at the Faculty of Architecture at the University of Hong Kong (HKU). As a professional architect, he worked on a wide range of adaptive reuse projects in historical scenarios, recently including the state of State Theater in Hong Kong. In turn, Rui Leão is an architect whose practice covers architecture and urban planning projects, especially in Macau. It works in the teaching of architecture and in editorial works related to the areas of heritage and urbanism. He has a degree in Architecture from the Faculty of Architecture of Faup Porto, Portugal, in 1993, and has a doctorate in Architecture and Urbanism from RMIT, the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology, Australia.

item.title: Tariffs | UBS points to economic growth of 3.4%
item.description: The UBS AG added yesterday to a series of low-chinese economy growth reviews the most pessimistic forecast among major banks, predicting that only 3.4 percent will expand this year, reflecting the impact of US tariffs. The Swiss bank, which previously foresaw a 4 percent growth in 2025, maintained its estimate for next year in 3 percent. Both forecasts are the lowest of all projections compiled by Bloomberg agency. "Tariff shock puts unprecedented challenges to exports to China and will trigger a major adjustment to the home economy," wrote UBS economists, including Tao Wang, in a note published yesterday. Goldman Sachs Group and Citigroup are among the global banks that have reduced their prospects for China in recent days, with most economists doubting that Beijing can achieve the official growth objective of about 5 percent this year. If the current increases in customs rates are maintained, it is likely to drag China's Gross Domestic Product growth at more than 2 percent, despite the expected additional stimuli of Beijing, according to the UBS. Economists admitted that their opinion has “high margins of error” due to the “extremely large uncertainty” surrounding the ongoing trade war. Exports to the US should fall two thirds in the next quarters and the total shipments abroad may fall 10% in dollars this year, they added. "We think some of China's other business partners will also be able to increase rates on Chinese products in the coming months, but probably only about specific products and not in US tariffs," they said.

item.title: Restoration and retail with recipe breaks in February
item.description: In February, retail trade volume suffered a 28.2 percent reduction in annual terms, measured by the volume of electronic payments. The data were revealed yesterday by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). In the second month of the year, the turnover was 4.26 billion patacas. item.description: * Assistant and coordinator researcher at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center I The old silk routes Two routes connected the Han Dynasty to the West from the second century BC. The South and North Route, both extended from Chang 'an/XI's to the West, the North through Central Asia, the Caspian Sea, and the South, led to the Mediterranean, Genoa and Venice, Irah and Iraq. Historically, the old silk route divided into four periods: From the second century BC to the 6th century, having as high points the diffusion of the Buddhism and emergency of Islam; 2) From the beginning of the seventh century to the late tenth century, the highlight being the diffusion of porcelain; 3) From the eleventh century to the fifteenth century, with the heyday of the diffusion of Islamic and Hindu religions and tax trade in East Asia, the relics of the wreck and 7 trips of Admiral Zheng He (鄭和), between 1405-1431, as well as the emergence of multicultural communities such as Guangzhou, Malaca (Malásia) and Galle (Sri Lanka); 4) mid -century. XV to the nineteenth, with emphasis on the exchange of porcelain goods, peppers and spices, globalization of routes and diffusion of Catholicism, and the predominance of other routes, such as those opened by the Portuguese in the Atlantic to the Pacific, through the Indian Indian, especially the Cape Route. This route started in the 15th and 16th centuries in Lisbon reached India, China and Japan, particularly Nagasaqui, and beyond, Timor, in a project that begins to be outlined by D. João II in 1487, being fulfilled by D. Manuel 1, with the fleet led by Vasco da Gama that would lead to India, near Calecute on May 17, 1498. Farther, Macao, where we established between 1555 and 1557, with scholars, such as Eduardo Kol de Carvalho, who advocate the interesting thesis of ensuring the Route of Japan, opened from 1543 and guaranteed by the Nau do Trato, which made the connection between India and Japan, having elected Macau for the necessary commercial interplay of the Portuguese silk, the territory of this trade Macao in 1557, the base the Portuguese founded on the Chinese coast to support the tract ”(Carvalho, 2018, 77). For these channels of the old chinese silk routes, silk, lacquer, porcelain and tea arrived in Europe, being transmitted to China glass, gems or precious stones, certain fruits and dry fruits, especially grapes, guavas, cucumbers, as well as other vegetables, for example, garlic and carrots. In addition to agricultural exchanges, also Chinese technological inventions such as gunpowder, the manufacture of paper, impression and compass, or the circulation of ideas and, above all, those that made up religious philosophies. Then, with a sea route of the Portuguese silk, between the 15th and 16th centuries the trade globalized entirely, everything changed and negotiated, transmitted and influenced. II The new silk route, including the 21st century sea If the term “Route of Silk” dates back to the ancient Greek geographers and, in particular, Marinus, already “silk sea route”, is from the twentieth century, an alliance arising in a covenant between the French synologist Édouard Chavannes (1865-1918) and the Japanese with their maritime porcelain trade studies in the 1960s. The Chinese begin to mention the “sea silk route” in 1974, first with the scholar Jao Tsung-i (饒宗頤, 1917-2018), then explicitly with Chen Yan (陳炎) “Silk Maritime Route” (丝绸之路) from 1980. The “renewed” version that was born in 2013, announced in Kazakhstan, as a track and route (一带一路) at the initiative of the current Chinese president, XI Jinping (习近平), based on the principle of connectivity, aims to connect Asia, Europe and Africa through land and maritime routes. The six land corridors well and briefly systematized by Professor Fernanda Ilhéu in “The Last Silk Route that History Knowed and the New Silk Route that History will know” (Ilhéu, 2018: 145) are: China-Mongolia-Russia; 2) China-Pakistan; 3) China-Bangladesh-India- Myanmar; 4) China-Peninsula of Indochina; 5) New European Earth Bridge; 6) China-Central Western, Central Hands. They converge all tracks to Europe, Duisburg, Germany, including the sea, of great importance to China, as 90% of Chinese trade is performed by this way. Of course China aims to ensure its sources of energy supply, either oil and natural gas, to which a hub from some central Asian countries, such as Turquemenistan, Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan and Russia, “being China since 2014 the largest world importer” (ibidem). Also according to data provided by Fernanda Ilhéu, since China joined the World Trade Organization in 2001, she was preparing her way to become an increasingly international economy, reaching in 2010 the Statute of Second World Economy (Ilhéu, 2018, 147). The country to maintain this statute, or perhaps even overcome it, needs to continue with its plan of 4 or 5 modernizations, maintaining the connection abroad for this purpose, that is, the Going Out policy has to continue. Thus transit a first phase of globalization, that of direct exports and foreign direct investment abroad (IDEE), for a second phase of globalization, as stressed Ilhéu (2018, 149) in the form of mergers and acquisitions in Asia, Europe and Africa, as well as in the Americas or Oceania. Then comes a new sea route from the silk that extends from Chongqing to Fuzhou in southern China, passes through Malaca in Malaysia, goes to Mombaça in Kenya (branch to Cape Verde and Santos in Brazil), heads to the Chinese African military base in Djibouti, then to the port of Pyreu in Greece (Ramifications for Madrid and Sines and Brazil), for Venice) Italy and Rotterdam in the Netherlands (branches for Panama and South American countries). Places related to the silk sea route within China are the coastal regions of Hebei, Jiangsu, Shanghai, Zhejiang, Fujian, Guangdong, Guangxi, Hainan and Macao Special Administrative Region, as well as the Huang-Bohai seas, Changjiang River Basin, East China Sea and Taiwan's Strait, Senior China Sea, Japan archipelago, Korea Peninsula, which is the plaque of East Asia. As Professor Carlos Gaspar (2020) saw in The World of Tomorrow: Contemporary Geopolitics, China performs through the initiative of the Track and Route (Bri) of its various silk corridors, terrestrial, maritime and polar, a strategy of political, economic, cultural and technological connectivity. Notable advances in mobile telecommunications are distinguished here, such as the 5G network and also in port and rail infrastructure. Moreover, it has the control of Darwin's main marine ports in the Pacific, Hambantotta in Indian, Pyreu in the Mediterranean, Kirkenes in the Arctic, having built in Kazakhstan the dry port of Khorgos, as well as the dry port of Duisburg in Germany. Note that these routes are essentially commercial and their impact on foreign trade is immense, developing from the purchase and acquisition of ports. Also according to Thiago Codongo, "for China it is also much more interesting to have the maritime control of several seas, lakes and narrows that are important to their goods, both to acquire and to sell." item.title: AL | Sam Hou Fai launches support for birth, but warns for budget revenues
item.description:
In his first lines of government action, Sam Hou Fai announced the creation of a new “childhood subsidy” that will assign up to 18,000 patacas per year to permanent residents under three years. However, it warned of economic difficulties
In the first lines and government action he presented to the population of Macau, Sam Hou Fai announced the creation of a new childhood allowance that will assign a maximum and 18,000 patacas per year to children under three years. In the Legislative Assembly, the Chief Executive revealed the creation of a new social support and the updating of others, underlined that the government places the well-being of the population as the great priority. Although it has only mentioned the “mitigation of population concerns” such as the third priority of the government's policies, behind other aspects such as the diversification of the economy and the efficiency of governance in the MSAR, Sam ensured that the population is the first priority: “The well-being of the population is fundamental. This government will persist in placing the interests of the population first and, taking into account the subjects related to their daily life, to solve the real problems. More pressing, with a view to responding to their aspirations for a quality life, ”he promised. As part of this policy, Sam Hou Fai has announced the support changes that are mainly intended to promote the increase in the birth rate and to support the elderly population or with special needs. At birth, the big news was the creation of the “childhood assistance subsidy” that will assign to each permanent resident child up to three years old an amount of 1,500 patacas per month, which can reach a maximum of 18 thousand patacas per year. This incentive is added an increase of 1,082 patacas from the birth subsidy, which rises from current 5,418 patacas to 6,500 patacas. Also the marriage subsidy is increased by 78 patacas, 2,122 patacas to 2,220 patacas. For the elderly At the level of support for the elderly, the elderly subsidy is increased by 1,000 patacas, rising from the maximum annual amount of 9,000 to 10,000 patacas. At the same time, the pension for the elderly is updated from a monthly amount of 3,740 per month to 3,900 patacas per month, a difference of 160 patacas per month. As this pension is paid thirteen times throughout the year, the maximum amount rises 2,080 patacas, from current 48,620 patacas to 50,700 patacas. Regarding residents with disability, normal allowance will be increased to 10,000 patacas per year, compared to current 9,000 patacas. The special disability allowance has a larger increase from the current 18,000 patacas to 20,000 patacas, a difference of 2,000 patacas. Another of the news is an update of health valleys, which will rise to 700 patacas, when they are currently 600 patacas. Economics warnings At the economy level, although without ever mentioning the new trade war between the United States and China, the chief executive warned that the Economy of the MSAR will not pass unscathed, although it can count on the interior market. "We have witnessed, in recent years, the aggravation of unilateralism and protectionism, the insufficiency of dynamics prone to world economic growth, as well as the increase of unforeseen events and uncertainties," he said. "Deep and complex changes in the internal and external environment have already manifested and will persist, so Macau, as a microeconomic strongly turned outside, could not be immune to the resulting impacts," he added. "For all this, we should not underestimate any threats and challenges, before, we must always be aware of the risks and a sense of warning, so that we are prepared to act against all potential threats," he warned. Sam Hou Fai also acknowledged that the current revenues are below the expected and that there may be a need to have a reformulation of the mashed budget in force. In terms of economy support, the government leader has announced a bank credit interest bonus plan for small and medium enterprises, which will allow entrepreneurs to obtain up to 4 percent of loan interest rates for three years, a maximum of 5 million patacas. The maximums of bonusted total loans cannot exceed 10 billion patacas. Checks with “Requirements” In yesterday's presentation, Sam Hou Fai said that the amounts paid in the pecuniary checks will remain, ensuring that the pecuniary reimbursement program should be changed, without being announced which. "After the hell of the opinions of all sectors of the company, the improvement of a monetary regime will be performed, using savings in expenses to increase the welfare of residents and promote the development of the community economy." In the same session it was mentioned that the money is attributed to residents “who meet the requirements”, so it remains to know what these requirements will be. Focus on terrorism In the lag presented yesterday by Sam Hou Fai National Security had a lower prominence in the face of the speeches of Ho IAT SENG. Still, it has been indicated that for this year the reformulation of the State Security Defense Commission will be studied and new laws will be thought of to combat terrorism. In the context of nationalism, framed in the chapter of national security, it was explained that the government will further support associations considered as patriotic, while events will be organized to celebrate the 80th anniversary of the War Victory against Japan. Cash reform At the public administration level, the Chief Executive announced that he will submit a proposal to reformulate the Institute for Municipal Affairs. The bill must enter the Legislative Assembly by the end of the year. The changes have not been detailed, but the great goal is to "simplify the organic structure of the government and raise the efficiency of its functioning." Also the Directorate of Administration and Public Services will be reformulated this year. In addition, Sam Hou Fai has promised that civil servants will begin to oath loyalty.
