item.title: Literature | Dora Nunes Gago closes Macau's trilogy with “gray flowers”
item.description:
Dora Nunes Gago, writer and former director of the Portuguese Department of Portuguese, has just launched a new poetry book. "Flowers of Gray" ends the trilogy of works dedicated to Macau, composed of "flowered by mistake the angry roses" and "Nomadic Words"
It was ten years that translated into many words. So many, who gave three books, “they were mistakenly flowered to the angry roses”, clearly reference to Camilo Pessanha; “Nomadic Words” and now “Gray Flowers”. Dora Nunes Gago's new poetry book, a teacher and former director of the Portuguese Department of Macao (one), also refers to Macau who lasts in his memory and, therefore, translates into words. With the seal of Humus, the book has just left Portugal, resulting from the "many poems" written by Dora Nunes Gago during the period in Macao, an experience that turned her into an published and award -winning author. Writing poetry in these years of teaching and experience the East turned out to be the way found to deal with Macau's reviliations and their dynamics. “Perhaps because it is a shorter record, a way to capture moments, of crystallizing them, in the midst of all the bullshit and surprises that Macau dresses. Maria Ondina Braga referred to the work“ Statue de Sal ”, written in Macao, around 1963, that Macau is 'sleep of sleep and poetry'. Hm. “Gray flowers” ​​is called because he went to seek inspiration from a poem from Natália Correia: “(…) young people oblivious to the pulcitude of the body in celebration / pass me as cypresses of cypresses / And the youth gray flower is an edge / shutting me opening vacuums of wild flowers (…) / galloping in a dream with foam.” Dora Nunes Gago selected the “surviving poems” of the remaining two titles of the trilogy. “There were those who were lost, between changes, travel, blocks and lost notebooks.” Like the whole macao's own revocation. In "Gray Flowers," the territory "is represented by rituals, the symbolic times like the Chinese New Year, which is that festive time when the world is reborn and inventing itself." There are also elements that become poetry such as the dumplings, the temples, the island of Hengqin, where the author lived in the days she taught at one. “The territory is present in the images, but also in the solitude and silence that inhabits the poems, all of them very short. In this book, my obsession with synthesis culminated,” he describes. Each book, a message There are poems that speak for themselves, others who need to be explained. And speaking of the trilogy he has written in recent years, Dora Nunes Gago refers to the first, where the pessanha symbolism is sought and where he denotes "the first look at Asia and Macao." Here there is no poetry, but 24 tales, "many of them inspired by witnessed stories, heard or read in newspapers." Already the award -winning “Nomadic Words”, winner of the Grand Travel Literature Prize Maria Ondina Braga last year, contains 50 chronicles. "It was the way to find a guiding thread to unite various experiences and learning that had a conductive thread for my life." Behold, in the last book of the trilogy, 55 poems, organized into three parts, namely “exhibitions, permanences and returns” are gathered. They are “a synthesis of all my route,” he says. “Gray Flowers” ​​is “Perhaps the most autobiographical book of the three, as it is rooted in multiple feelings, in a kind of instantaneous ones that configured my days,” says the author. From the preface, by Maria João Cantinho, it is read that the first of the trilogy, “flowered by mistake the Brave roses” is “a book of brief stories, whose title was taken from loan to a beautiful verse (and a poem) of the melancholy Camilo Pessanha, in Clepsidra”. While "nomadic words" brings together chronic chronicles that are born "from his experience in Macao, as well as his traveler and adventurous aspect, as the Teotónio Almeida needed very praised." In turn, in the third, Dora Gago "changes the record and we find ourselves in the face of poetic and sensitive writing, built by brief poems," he reads. Maria João Cantinho also understands that the poem “Destiny” is one of the most beautiful in “Flowers of Gray”: “In the crazy run / of the abandoned / lonely Galgo of existing, lick the wounds of death / in the skin of the poem.” Here, it is described “poetic writing is presented as vertigo (‘ in the crazy race ’) driven by a allegorical impetus, in which the presence of death emerges”, where “fate is certainly this disadvantaged race in which death surrounds the living and only the poem can save or redeem those”, considers Maria João Cantinho. For this, "Dora Nunes Gago's writing contains a reflective dimension, addressing topics such as the creation or passage of time, among many others, and using a rich, vocabulary and prosodic level language in the search for effects that accentuate the tension of the poem." “Exiles”, the first part of the work, starts with “beginning”, a simple name for a short poem: “I follow the memory footprints / inscribed in the sand of time / and I am a ship / anchored without leme / no breath”. Perhaps marked by longing and distance, we find “absence”: “They dance solemn ashes / Silvando Winds of Saudade, / Heavens / Spelled / In Blood / Solitude.” And as this book is made of comings and goings, the work ends with "return", as if it was a timeline: "Watering the house / tattooing hills and valleys / on the retina, / watering the flowers of gray / reborn / in stony cracks / of hope." Dora Nunes Gago is a native of São Brás de Alportel and is currently a teacher at the Setúbal Polytechnic Institute. About “Nomadic Words”, the Jury of the Grand Prix of Travel Literature Maria Ondina Braga, granted by the Portuguese Writers Association (APE), considered it to be a “work of varied and rich observations concerning the places where the reports of great sensory livelihood, which do not lack the intimate look at places and people designating as 'Génie du Lieu' ”. "In a prose of great fluidity, eavized of reflections where perceptions, memories, culture, literature and history are intersected, the author has been able to lead a reading reading from the first pages, whose rhythm and interest can maintain throughout the considerable extension of the work," said the same jury.

item.title: LAG 2025 | Checks, economy and great bay should be sam hu fai bets
item.description:
The government lines for this year are presented on Monday, marking the debut of Sam Hou Fai in one of the most anticipated moments of the local political calendar. Game recipes and economic predictions should be on the table, according to José Sales Marques and Lou Shenghua. The future of pecuniary checks may be another matter to be in attention
Sam Hou Fai has been in the government for almost five months and is preparing to present, next Monday, his first report of the Governing Action Lines (LAG) for this year. Great expectations often reside in the amounts of pecuniary checks, the values ​​attributed to social support and other budgetary predictions, especially after the territory has been through a hard economic period with Covid-19. LAG 2025 should focus on these themes, and Macao's integration into the various regional cooperation projects, such as Hengqin Island or the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay. Fulfilling the annual tradition of local politics, Sam Hou Fai made the usual round of auscultations to local associations, in order to know his opinions on the main measures to take. Listened to by HM, economist José Sales Marques expects clarity in the policies announced at the economic level. "I would like to see these LAG bring greater clarity on economic policies and the vision for the future of MSAR. I speak of structural measures that encourage the trust of the private investor, and that also realize such reforms of public administration to increase efficiency and effectiveness," he said. Sales Marques also said that "I would like to clearly see Macao's positions and priorities in his relationship with countries and regions of the world, including measures that lead to deepen the role of Sino-Midfone and Multicultural Dialogue Platform." Lou Shenghua, a political analyst and professor at Macao Polytechnic University (UPM), said the main ideas presented will be in accordance with what Sam Hou Fai presented in the electoral program. "The tonic can be placed in improving the effectiveness of governance, moderate economic diversification, the construction of the Hengqin cooperation zone and the issues related to the subsistence means of people," said the analyst, stressing that "citizens may be more concerned with subsistence -related issues." And what program presented Sam Hou Fai in September last year, when it was glimpsed that he would be the only candidate for the position of Chief Executive? A program that has as its “maximum objective to meet citizens' expectations for a better life” and the “fundamental orientation of implementing the principle of a country, two systems” in a full, correct and firm way ”. The importance of national security was not forgotten, referring to the need for defense “of sovereignty, security and interests of the country's development”. About the sin, Sam Hou Fai said he wanted to erect a "macao based on the rule of law, dynamic, cultural and happy." The then only candidate to head the government promised to improve the government's governing capacity. "We will strive to raise the capacity and level of governance of MSAR, the change in the concepts of governance, the optimization of the form of governance, the persistence of macao governance in accordance with the law, and the deepening of the reform of public administration and the legal system." Thus, he said "optimizing forms of governance, giving greater importance to the role of advisory bodies, experts and academics, and love associations of the country and Macao, widely listening to the opinions and suggestions of various sectors, different industry branches and various social strata." It remains to be seen if the lag will bring these tin aspects to the field of actions and concrete measures. MATE On Monday, the agenda continues as usual in the presentation of a report of the lag. First Sam Hou Fai will go to the Legislative Assembly, from 15h, make a general presentation to the deputies of political and budgetary issues essential for this year, following a press conference. The next day, it is a day of debate in the hemicycle on the same report, then followed the sectoral debates with all secretaries until the 30th of this month. One of the political themes that have been in the DAY ORDER is the value of pecuniary checks and whether or not they are attributed to residents living outside Macao. There are analysts to defend the reformulation of the program, but Sales Marques recalls that "the amount expected for pecuniary checks in the budget discussion for 2025 is 10,000 patacas for permanent residents." “Predicted budget revenues were based on calculation a gross revenue forecast of 240 billion patacas to an average of 20 billion per month. It turns out that the effective revenues obtained until the end of the first quarter of this year were short, with a deviation of less than four billion. be hit. ” Given these less optimistic predictions, referred to by the secretary himself for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP last week, Sales Marques believes that, if there is adjustments in the checks, will be "small". "As for the distribution method, I predict that it remains the same," he said. Lou Shenghua believes that "the pecuniary reimbursement plan may change." "In terms of amount, it is likely to maintain the value of ten thousand patacas per resident, but regarding the form, it can be attributed to consumer valleys," he said. Last day 1, Secretary Tai Kin IP said the budget accounts are still short of expected. "We noticed that in the first three months of 2025 the gross revenues of the games reached 57.66 billion patacas, remaining the value almost unchanged in annual terms, not yet reaching the expected monthly average of 20 billion patacas." Thus, it was left the warning that "this year's financial revenues may not be as optimistic as it is expected", and it is necessary to "seriously study the future economic situation and persist in the management of financial resources with prudence." Game and other stories Regarding the game sector, which continues to have a predominant weight in the economy, Sam Hou Fai confirmed significantly a month ago that concessionaires and satellite casinos have until the end of the year to prepare the transition to a subconsers' exploration model. It will be in the "hands" of the dealers to decide whether or not to explore these casinos directly. For Sales Marques, this dossier “worries several sectors of society, not only about the use of its workers, but also for the repercussion that will close in the areas of the city where they are, especially in retail and restoration trade, small trade in general”. Thus, "it will be prudent to avoid great shocks in the current conjuncture." "Everything will be done to regularize these units under the law in force, without provoking their immediate closure," he added. Lou Shenghua hopes to “have room for negotiation about the distribution of revenues between the satellite casinos and the dealers”. Despite the concerns that reside in the unemployment of these people, Sam Hou Fai advanced in March to TDM that these fears can be removed. "I know that satellite casinos workers are distributed to the game companies, so operators have the responsibility of absorbing them or having plans for these workers," he said. Laws for I want you Given the history of Sam Hou Fai in court, as it has presided over the court of last instance since the establishment of the MSAR, some new measures can be expected in the area of ​​law. Sales Marques deposits expectations in the creation of new regulations “that are more facilitators to the operation of the economy”, quite “more favorable to the competitive business environment of this Great Bay region, namely as to the hiring of qualified human resources, conditions offered to their stay and that of their families and less bureaucratic administratives”. Lou Shenghua believes it could, in fact, “pay more attention to legal reform,” although it should be in accordance with government policies and follow the pace of times, not being reformed just because yes, ”he said.

item.title: LAG 2025 | Government wants to create an integrated vocational training platform
item.description:
In the debate on the government lines for this year, the Chief Executive highlighted the initiative to create an “integrated vocational training platform” for young people who have difficulty finding their first job. Of the 7,100 unemployed, about 4,000 are young people, said the ruler
There is structural unemployment in Macao and this is “notorious”. Representative NGAN Iek Hang raised the issue in yesterday's debate about the Government Action Lines (LAG) report and demanded concrete measures to the government. "Many young people have difficulty finding work in their area of ​​specialization, and many residents have tightened their belt and have been more prudent in spending. How will I improve employment support with a multidimensional approach, ensuring the use of residents?" Sam Hou Fai, in his narrow as chief executive to present the lag and discuss them with the deputies, announced the creation of an “integrated vocational training platform” that includes government secretariats, local associations and companies to make specific courses depending on the needs of the business environment. “Currently, the unemployment rate is 2.4 percent, about 7,100 unemployed, and four thousand are young. It is a structural unemployment and is a situation that has emerged in the last two years. There are many specific courses finalists, such as medicine, which cannot find employment. For areas, ”he said. Sam Hou Fai also added that the proposal came from the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP. "We also have to rely on the secretary's protection O LAM [Social Affairs and Culture], because it also has to do with education. Regarding the accreditation and professional certification, it is necessary to count on government participation, associations and companies, and the next stage is to create this integrated platform taking into account the experiences of neighboring territories," he said. Attention to satellite casinos Sam Hou Fai also recalled the unemployment resulting from the possible closure of satellite casinos as an example of the need for specific courses depending on the needs of the local economy. "Regarding the satellite casinos, we will have to see in two or three months to know the needs of the unemployed and then we can organize specific actions for certain areas," he explained. The objective of the future integrated training platform is to “solve the problem of human resources”, given that hiring non-resident workers “is just a supplementary support measure that will be changed taking into account the transformation of Macau and its concrete situation”. The Chief Executive recalled the training actions that already exist between the Macao Workers' Federation of the Federation of Associations and the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs, as well as the game operators. "We have to take into account the 1+4 diversification strategy and create courses that give diplomas. We have to rely on companies to combine efforts," he concluded.

item.title: Book | Mark O'Neill tells the history of Europeans in the early days of Hong Kong
item.description:
“Europeans in Hong Kong” is the 18th and new book by British writer and journalist Mark O'Neill, who lives in the neighboring region. At HM, he confesses that he began to write the history of the Irish, but the project eventually expanded. As such, it focused on the stories of Europeans who left their brand in Hong Kong, including Portuguese
Hong Kong, the city of banking, finance and commerce, a worldwide warehouse for centuries and a gateway to China. It has been the neighboring region throughout the time, since its institution, in 1841. Hong Kong has always been an international territory populated by Europeans of various nationalities, much more than the British who administered the territory until 1997. It was missing to tell its story, and British author and journalist Mark O'Neill, residing in Hong Kong since the late 1970s, now has it now with “European Europeans in Hong Kong], which even includes a chapter about the Portuguese. In another work that has just left the newsstands, the author confesses to HM who began to write the history of the Irish in Hong Kong, whose contribution to the "was huge" territory. This work was not published, being born later the idea of ​​doing something bigger. “I chose the figures that made the greatest contributions, especially at the religious level, or teachers, writers, great figures in the business world and those whose legacies still last,” he confessed. Mark O'Neill points out that the great contribution of Europeans in the neighboring region took place in the educational area, but not only. "The most lasting contribution was given by schools, universities, hospitals, homes of elderly, social assistance institutions and some companies. Although they are entities that are currently managed, largely, by people from Hong Kong, were founded and fed by Europeans." The author explains that the most impressive story associated with the legacy of the French arises on the cover of the book. "In the nineteenth century, the French nuns adopted tens of thousands of Chinese girls who had been abandoned and gave them a good life. Without them, girls would have died or worked as child labor, maids or prostitutes," he said. Another house Asked about the new perceptions that the book can bring to the general public, Mark O'Neill understands that he is today "familiar with the history of British in Hong Kong, but not with the history of continental Europe." Thus, the author says he hopes that "the book will help them understand their history, especially their contribution." In general terms, "in the early decades [of the Hong Kong Foundation], Europeans were, above all, business men and missionaries, both Catholic and Protestants." Then the region grew “as a great Asian city and, from the 1950s, the community expanded.” "Currently, we have architects, engineers, musicians, teachers, restaurant owners, doctors, lawyers, art and people experts in all the domains of life," said the author. Another prominent figure in “Europeans in Hong Kong” is the Jesuit Hungarian Father Laszlo Ladany, considered the “China's greatest observer in the world for thirty years”, and Anders Nelson, “Swedish singer and long-standing resident in Hong Kong, well known to local inhabitants”, describes the introduction of the work. “Most people think that Hong Kong was built by the Chinese during their 150 years of British dominance, which is not entirely accurate. As the reader will discover, many of the schools, social assistance institutions, buildings and companies in the city were founded and managed by people from Europe (defined here as 'east of calais'). They forced it, ”is described in the same introduction. Mark O'Neill also describes that the Hong Kong cemeteries contain traces of this presence, as "Europeans have enjoyed the city and their people more than their homeland." The European presence increased in the neighboring region from 1949, when the People's Republic of China is founded, as "the new Chinese government closed the doors to foreigners, with the exception of a small number of people from other socialist countries." Thus, "eager to remain in China and in the Chinese world, many Europeans have moved from mainland China to Hong Kong," he is mentioned. The Macaense Legacy The fourth chapter is entirely dedicated to the Portuguese and Macaense Hong Kong community, regarded as a “pillar of society” for many years. “For 150 years, the Portuguese were, after the British, the largest non-Chinese community in Hong Kong,” reads the work, which draws the profile of five personalities and describes two social clubs where the community was. Regarding the personalities, the example of José Pedro Braga, the first Portuguese to be part of the Legislative Council, between 1927 and 1937; Sir Roger Lobo, member of the Executive Council between 1967 and 1985; and Commander Arnaldo de Oliveira Sales, first president of the urban council between 1973 and 1981. "The Portuguese played a key role in the government, in banks, the liberal professions and the commercial companies. They lived here for many generations. Most of the expatriates were only the time of their mission; when they renovated, departed and returned to Britain or another country in Europe. book. Regarding the origin of this community, it is described as a “mixed race”, or macanese, but also Portuguese with Asian origins. “Its history dates back to hundreds of years, in the early days of Portuguese trade and exploitation. In the 16th century, Portugal established commercial warehouses and religious missions in Goa, Malaca, Macau and Nagasaki. The Portuguese settlers married local women, creating a mixed root population in India, Malaysia, China and Japan. In 1639, the Japanese government expelled all foreigners and foreigners and isolated the country from the rest of the world. ” Macao emerges closely linked to this community, as it became, in the mid-16th century, “the basis of Portugal in East Asia” after the Dutch blocked Goa and won Malacca. "The Macanese began to form as a cohesive community-sharing ties with Portugal, the Catholic religion, a common language and kitchen and a feeling of distinction from the Portuguese colonials and their Chinese neighbors. They were the only people in Macao who spoke Portuguese and Cantonese, giving them a role of intermediaries essential for the proper functioning of government and business," he is explained. The fact that “the Hong Kong foundation has devastated the economy of Macao” made many macanese began to move from weapons and luggage to a much more brightly saving zone. After all, "just 66 kilometers away [Hong Kong] was the best deep water port in southern China within laws, administration and military protection in the largest empire in the world."

item.title: EPM | Paulo Rangel guarantees increased financial support after 11 years of cuts
item.description:
On a lightning visit to Macao, Portugal's Foreign Minister argued that the position the country maintains in the European Union does not affect the relationship with China. During Paulo Rangel's visit, it was also announced that Sam Hou Fai should visit Portugal during the summer
He met with Sam Hou Fai, with counselors from the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, Portuguese educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Thus was the visit of Paulo Rangel, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Portugal, in the short visit to the MSAR, which took place on Friday. There are no passages in the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, Paulo Rangel also moved to Hong Kong to visit the exhibition “Lusas Stories”, dedicated to the Portuguese community of the territory, patent at the Hong Kong History Museum. In China, Paulo Rangel was present at the Boao Forum in Haião. In an interview with TDM, the minister assured that Portugal's relations with China remain good, denying that the country's position in the European Union's position (EU) can represent some kind of obstacle. "Anyone who thinks that Portugal's presence in the EU is harmful to Portugal's relationship with China, does not realize Portugal's relationship with China and does not realize the role of Portugal in the international picture. I realize that some people do not understand, but honestly we have to see it as more value. And this is seen like this," he said. One of the voices that criticized Portugal's position in relation to stories such as the issue of Huawei and Rede 5G was Amelia António, lawyer and president of the House of Portugal in Macau. “My expectation is not high. I would like you minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the EU positions, so fiercely, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. It should not be lost sight of, ”he told Paulo Rangel to Macao. The EPM question In the interview given to TDM, Paulo Rangel also commented on the issue of EPM, stressing the points that were not on the agenda, namely the works of expansion of the facilities. "This question has not yet been addressed. There are, in fact, several issues that have to be detailed and resolved, and one or the other that have not yet been put on the table. We know that there is search for it, but and I am being totally transparent, it is a question that is not yet on the table." According to Lusa, Paulo Rangel also announced that the government increased financial support to the EPM, returning to the legally expected level after 11 years of cuts. "We just replaced the Portuguese contribution to the Portuguese School of Macao, which (…) had suffered a huge cut," Rangel said on Friday. The Portuguese State holds the majority (51 percent) of the capital of the EPM foundation, but since 2014 that Lisbon only contributed with 10 percent of school expenses, a decision taken under the Portuguese financial rescue program. EPM financing “is now at legal levels again and is the first time at the end of 11 years,” he said. Shortly thereafter, the chief of Portuguese diplomacy told reporters that "there was no reason, honestly, to have this cut and he remained." "We have increased five times this value [of EPM financing], so this is something that is highly significant from the commitment we have." "There are governments that really give importance to Macau and China and there are others who do not give, this is something that has to be said," lamented the minister, pointing his finger at the previous executive of the Socialist Party. The replacement of financing “is undoubtedly an important help” for EPM, which Rangel described as having a key role for Portugal in Macau. "We also have pleased ... that there have never been so many Portuguese students - and now I speak of students from the Chinese community - as there are today in multiple schools," added the leader. "It means that also the special administrative region [of Macau] has encouraged Portuguese teaching and knowledge of Portuguese, and this is something that can only bring good relations between the two sides," added Rangel. SAM in Portugal From the meeting with Sam Hou Fai, which also took place on Friday, came some ideas and opinions on “Bilateral Exchange and Cooperation in the Judicial, Economic-Commercial, Education, among others,” says an official note from the Social Communication Office. Sam Hou Fai led to the meeting topics such as “the most current development of the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Henqing”, and remembered that “Paulo Rangel is the first foreign ministerial guardian he receives after the executive's head of the executive, a fact that reflects the good relations between Macao and Portugal with a longtime history”. The head of the executive also pointed out that after December 20, 1999, Macau, "with strong support from the central government, has insisted on maintaining the principle of" a country, two systems ", preserving the continental legal system, traditional culture and customs, as well as actively maintaining the connection and foster relations with Portugal." The ruler also said that "Macao has deepened the role of bridge and platform between China and Lusophone countries, continuously boosting the establishment of friendly relationships in the various areas of bilateral cooperation." Another novelty of this meeting was the information, advanced by Sam Hou Fai himself, which “expects to visit Portugal in the near future” without, however, a concrete date has been announced. Rangel announced that the chief executive of Macao is expected to visit Portugal "immediately before August or in September." "There is clearly here also an alignment of the priorities that is highly symbolic," said the diplomat, on the fringes of a meeting with the Portuguese community in Macau. Asked about the restrictions to Portuguese in accessing the resident status, Rangel said he spoke with Sam Hou Fai "on all the issues that are relevant to the relationship between Portugal and the MSAR." "But, as it is a dialogue that is underway, I have a duty to give the opportunity we can, with the questions that have been raised from one part and the other, now we have space and time to build solutions," he added. Rangel said that the "follow -up of dialogue" with Sam Hou Fai will take place at a meeting of the Portugal -Raem Joint Commission, "which will be organized in principle in the second semester here in Macao." Paulo Rangel also said, in an interview with TDM, that the visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, “will happen a little later”, precisely due to the marking of new elections in the country. Initially, the aim was that Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa came to Macao in June to commemorate Portugal, Camões and Portuguese communities. The visit should take place in the following months of summer, predicted Paulo Rangel. Encounters and mismatches Paulo Rangel also had a meeting with local associative representatives, including with the Portuguese communities counselor. Francisco Mannhão, president of the Macao Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners Association (Apomac), took the opportunity to talk about the bureaucracy that still exists in the relationship with the Caixa Geral de Retirement (CGA). "To dispatch a survival pension process takes six months and then the correspondence goes back and forth. Macao benches do not have Iban, and this, for example, delays the whole process. Whenever a process goes to CGA, they insist that they do not have the number of IBAN and NIF [Fiscal Identification Number], that most of the widows receiving survival pensions, do not have in Portugal." exemplified. Mannão also compliments to the Portuguese politician. "For a short time he was here, he showed concern. I liked the presence of the minister." In addition, Francisco Mannão stressed that “in a good time the Portuguese government appointed Alexandre Leitão to Consul”, also recalling the good work of the previous Portuguese consul, Vítor Sereno. "The consulate has never been as well functioned as now. The criticism made to our consul are unfair. There were our associates who told me to have been admired for making a marking and was attended the next day," he said. More bet on the language Another important point of Rangel's visit was the promise of the reinforcement of Mandarin teaching in Portugal. "With the Chinese authorities I made a point of saying that we will be very committed to teaching Chinese in Portugal." In the Chinese capital, Rangel met with Chinese counterpart, Wang Yi, before meeting with Chinese vice-minister, Ding Xuexiang, on Hailão Island, where the Boao Forum took place. "The situation today is much better than it was 20 years ago ... We have, in fact, a formation that we did not have at all," said Paulo Rangel. The formation of fluent people in Mandarin “is also decisive for our future”, but “it is not enough for the challenges we have ahead,” he warned. Lame

item.title: MNE | BIR OF PORTUGUESE AND EPM are topics to discuss with Paulo Rangel
item.description:
During the visit to Macao of Portuguese Foreign Minister, Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to discuss the end of access to BIR access by Portuguese. The president of the House of Portugal in Macau associates this article with the position of Lisbon in the issue of 5G
It is another visit of a Portuguese ruler to Macau, but Paulo Rangel's first as Minister of Foreign Affairs of the executive of Luis Montenegro, at a time when the country is preparing to go to votes in May after the dissolution of the Assembly of the Republic. After a journey through China, Paulo Rangel will meet with local associative leaders in order to perceive existing problems related to the Portuguese community. At HM, Amelia António, president of the House of Portugal in Macau (CPM), argues that the difficulties of obtaining residence by Portuguese should be one of the pressing matters. “My expectation is not high. I would like the Minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the positions of the European Union (EU) so fierce, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. of the EU, and this should not be lost sight of. ” Amelia António highlights the position that Portugal adopted in the case of Rede 5G and Huawei, but also “the development that occurred in relation to the coming of Portuguese to Macau, subject to Blue Card”. “I have the feeling that everything comes following this EU policy against China. Portugal must have a position to safeguard these interests.” Speaking to Lusa, the official made similar complaints. "We are here, we suffer the consequences of these relationships [between Portugal and China], good or bad. We had very close relations for a long time, which changed with Covid. I have not seen things again as they were, and I think it was important that Mr. Minister explains what is the position," he said that Portugal does not have to "align faithfully with everything in Europe and, above all," Before the pandemic, he recalled the official, there was “permanent communication” and “much exchange” between the Portuguese and Chinese authorities. Today is noticeable a “hardening regarding the Portuguese” in macao immigration, Maria Amelia António declared, but not being able to affirm categorically whether the position is related to “this removal” between China and the West. Macao authorities have not accepted new requests for residence in the territory for Portuguese for the “exercise of specialized technical functions”, allowing for justification of family reunion or previous connection to the territory. Also Miguel de Senna Fernandes, lawyer and president of the Macanese Association, regrets the situation of the assignment of the BIR. "I would like the government of the Portuguese Republic to take into account the Portuguese community in the territory, which faces some difficulties regarding the possibility of obtaining the residence. It is a topic that may be addressed between the Portuguese State and the MSAR, to be greater flexibility to allow the Portuguese community to have greater accessibility to the right of residence, as existed before." For the causal, "Misrere does not have to randomly assign more homes, but it is something that corresponds only to my desire." "Of course, that Mand has its reasons and Macau is different, and there are other communities that are interested in staying in the territory. The Portuguese community, due to greater historical connection that has to the territory, is still another community, among others. As Portuguese we are, we would like to have greater flexibility," he admitted. The EPM case Another point that Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to see approached on Paulo Rangel's visit is the situation at the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the lack of teachers. "I think you should see the school and make a little more awareness of the situation, although the EPM is not from its area. As a member of the government it is important to realize that this situation has been poorly conducted, because in Portugal has been gone after some conversations that have little to do with reality and only harm. If he realized a little more of the situation, it would not be bad," said Amelia António. Already Miguel de Senna Fernandes says that it is time for the Portuguese executive to stop looking at the school as another Portuguese educational institution abroad. “EPM is always a recurring question, and it all depends on how the Portuguese state looks at school: if you look like any Portuguese school spread around the world, this is a mistake. There is no possible comparison, because the EPM emerged in a very special context.” However, to Lusa agency, Jorge Neto Valente, president of the EPM foundation, was categorical: the school “has nothing to peddling” to Paulo Rangel. "There is no whimper, we have nothing to do, we have nothing to demand, everything is normal," he said. The lawyer and president of the founding of the EPM said Rangel hoped "take a correct perception of the school, what it is for, the goals he has." “It's always good to have direct knowledge, it's much better than in papers,” said Neto Valente. "We have to account that the school is fulfilling the role that is expected to play," added the leader, recalling that the Portuguese State holds the majority of the capital of the EPM foundation. Still on the EPM universe, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, who also leads the Macanese Instruction Promoting Association (Apim), suggested a close look at the Chinese teaching in the EPM. "I have always advocated that Cantonese must have status. Because students, when they leave school, are in a singing world. This with all the merit that can have teaching in Mandarin," he said. "It is an issue that should be posed. It is a delicate question, because we are talking about an official language," he added, referring to Mandarin, an official language in China. The official, also vice president of the EPM foundation, admits that this is not a question that generates consensus -"many parents do not agree with this view" -but stresses that the learning of Cantonese "is a vehicle of integration", as it is the dominant language in the territory. Yes to the electronic vote Also to Lusa several associative leaders defended the transition to electronic vote, stressing embarrassment in the current options for emigration. "As long as it is not advanced without being tested, I am fully in agreement. The future is this and we have to point out," said the president of the CPM. In legislative elections, the Portuguese abroad have the possibility of exercising the right to vote in person or by post, while in presidential and European, the vote is in person. In the choice of correspondence, the government sends the address indicated in the census notebook the voting report and two envelopes, one green and one white, which must be returned to the Ministry of Internal Affairs after filling. The electronic option “can offer greater security”, defended Maria Amelia António. "With the consulates to work poorly, in order to have few employees, with their work, and in countries where they are far from the places where people live, it is very difficult for people to vote personally. There has also been a lot of failures in the guarantees of receiving vote [via mail]," he added. The electronic choice is a longstanding claim of the Portuguese Communities Council (CCP). Rui Marcelo, president of the Regional Council of the Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania, who has a meeting scheduled with the Portuguese Foreign Minister, said that the “theme is already part of the CCP agenda“ a few years ago and has been approached several times and with several governments ”. "With the advancement of technology and the possibility of implementing security systems that can ensure vote safety - which happens today through the provision of services in other areas of the government also - the conditions are created so that we can eventually evolve into a situation where it can obviously be a complement, but not a substitute," he noticed. In February, the Portuguese Parliament approved a resolution proposed by the PSD to test the electronic vote in emigration. The President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, suggested in December a pilot electronic voting experience in the circles of emigration. The head of Portuguese diplomacy arrives in Macau today after passing by Beijing and Haikou, in the province of Haião, where he was present at the Boao Forum. In Macao, Paulo Rangel has scheduled meetings with the head of local government, Sam Hou Fai, as well as the counselors of the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Visit the EPM and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, MNE goes to Hong Kong to visit “Lusas Stories”, an exhibition dedicated to the Portuguese community at the Hong Kong History Museum. Lame

item.title: Beijing, Hong Kong and Macau accuse the US of attacking China's survival
item.description: The Chinese Communist Party's main official for Hong Kong and Macao affairs and governments of both regions yesterday accused the United States of imposing tariffs to sabotage China. "The US has targeted our tariffs, they target our own survival," said Xia Baolong, director of the Hong Kong and Macau affairs, under the tutelage of the State Council. "Although Hong Kong is the largest source of US commercial surplus, the United States still imposed high tariffs. This is extremely arrogant and blatant," said Xia. "The US cannot tolerate Hong Kong's prosperity and stability and are the biggest sinister manipulator that undermines human rights, freedom, the rule of law, prosperity and stability in Hong Kong," the leader added. Xia spoke in a pre-recorded speech, transmitted during the inauguration of an exhibition in Hong Kong, regarding the Day of National Security Education. “Whoever tries to lead us back to poverty and weakness is our enemy,” warned the leader. "Those who betray national interests and cheer for the enemy at critical times will never be tolerated," he added. Chief Words Today, at the same ceremony, Hong Kong's government leader John Lee Ka-Chiu accused the United States of, in a "wicked logic," imposing tariffs to protect his "unhealthy hegemony." "The United States oppose free trade, interrupt global trade and supply chains (…), severely damaging the multilateral trade system and the process of globalization," said John Lee. The chief executive has assured that Hong Kong "will keep his status from Porto Franco with basically null fares" and will file a complaint against the United States to the World Trade Organization. Also the leader of the Macao government yesterday criticized the United States for the "abusive imposition of customs taxes on all its business partners," including China, "under several pretexts." Also during the inauguration of an exhibition due to National Security Education Day, Sam Hou Fai said Washington "severely devastated the multilateral trade system (...) and impaired the stability of the world economic order."

item.title: Sam Hou fai fear deficit but will review budget to reinforce support
item.description:
The new Macao government leader admitted yesterday to fear a deficit in 2025, due to the slowdown in the game's recipes, but reiterated that he will review the region's budget to reinforce social support. "I am worried, if game revenues only reach 15 billion [of patacas per month], it may result in a budget deficit," Sam Hou Fai told the deputies. It is recalled that Ho Iat Seng had predicted game revenues of 240 billion patacas by 2025, or 20 billion per month. But in the first three months of the year, Macao casinos registered total revenues of 57.7 billion patacas, below the Government target, despite an increase of 0.6 percent compared to the same period of 2024. “We have to have a feeling of risk,” warned Sam Hou Fai, during the debate on the Government Action Lines (LAG) to 2025, in the Legislative Assembly. Basic law requires public accounts to remain on positive land. The government leader recalled that China - by far the main source of tourists to Macau - fell into deflation (annual fall of consumer prices) in March for the second consecutive month, "but savings increased." Sam Hou Fai argued that these data show that the Chinese population also has "a feeling of risk", which was already before the new US president, Donald Trump, start a trade war with China.
Size is relative On Monday, at the press conference after the LAG presentation, the chief executive admitted that Trump's tariffs will have a "more indirect" impact on Macao. Sam Hou Fai pointed out as probable consequences the decrease, both of the consumption of local families and a break in the number of visitors and consumption, especially in case of devaluation of the Renmimbi. Still, the government leader guaranteed yesterday that he will review the budget to 2025, prepared by the predecessor, for measures such as the creation of a fund, worth 10 billion patacas, to support small and medium enterprises. Sam Hou Fai admitted that current expenses, social support and public function, "will only increase, not decrease," but preferred to focus on the diversification of public revenues. In the first two months of 2025, taxes on the game represented 89.3 percent of Macao government current revenues.

item.title: PME | Association applauds measure of interest bonus
item.description: The president of the Federal General Commercial Association of Small and Medium Enterprises of Macao, Wu Keng Kuong, considers that the interest rate bonus in local trade loans "will allow to meet the most urgent needs of companies." It was thus, according to the newspaper or Mun, that the entrepreneur reacted to the measure announced by Sam Hou Fai, on Monday, during the presentation of the lines of government action. Despite this positive aspect, Wu asked small and medium -sized companies (SME) to analyze the ability to pay debts if they decide to resort to the mechanism. Wu also appealed to SMEs to ponder their business models and whether the activity they exercise is economically viable. In this sense, the official argued that the government must make available counseling to SMEs to make the evaluation, as well as increase the financial literacy of entrepreneurs. "It is necessary to provide financial assistance for the sustainable development of small and medium enterprises, simultaneously controlling the risks of the financial system and ensuring the stability of the global economic environment," said Wu. At the same time, the entrepreneur highlighted the need for companies to modernize and adapt to new consumer models.

item.title: LAG 2025 | One will function as a test for future university city
item.description: Authorities want to build a university city in Hengqin so that more higher education institutions are established in the interior of China through local universities. This project, announced on the government lines for this year, will have the University of Macao (one) to participate in a first phase, as a kind of test, said yesterday Sam Hou Fai, head of the executive, in Hemiciclo. "It is feasible to put the start of this project in a public higher education institution and then we need to wait for the results of UM. In the second phase we will see how we can interact with private universities to create a university city," he said. In the gutter is the opening of the medical degree between the University of Lisbon and one, as well as courses in other areas, with opening scheduled for 2028. “The works are taking place, as well as the process of purchasing land. We have to break with many barriers defined in the [legal] regimes, because in the interior of China it is not possible for a foreign university to establish directly. From China, and we will see how these works take place, ”he explained. For the chief executive, this will be one of the government's most important tasks in order to ensure “international quality” as Macau “has advantages in capturing international higher education institutions to enter Hengqin Island”. "We also have to think of other public institutions, such as the University of Tourism of Macao, which can also cooperate with other entities abroad to settle in Hengqin," added the ruler. A new campus The issue about the creation of a university city in Hengqin was posed by Deputy Pang Chuan, who wanted to know "the role universities can play in the new university city." It is recently recalled that UM Vice Rector Rui Martins announced the creation of a new campus in the West Zone of Hengqin. "The new campus is expected to appear in the West Zone of Hengqin Island, having about half the surface of the current campus. It will have four colleges, namely the first Macao Public Medicine School, implemented in association with the Faculty of Medicine of the University of Lisbon. We will also have a Faculty of Information Science, Engineering and another of Design, which includes the architectural course," said the Chief Executive.

item.title: Public function | “Government operation is complicated,” says CE
item.description: The head of the executive said yesterday, in the debate with the deputies about the report of the Government Action Lines (LAG) for this year, that "the functioning of the government is very complicated", taking into account the existence of about 35,000 civil servants "that are dedicated to different social sectors." In addition, "one subject involves several departments and sometimes judicial bodies." Therefore, "if the government is more effective and has a good coordination, things work without startles." The ruler said he will coordinate a “working group for public administration”, assuming that “some civil servants can be transferred to other areas where workers are needed”. "We will optimize the structure of administration and civil service services and we have to work well with Hengqin services, namely those who coordinate the transionic services," he said. Tariffs | Deputy defends advantages in terms of transportation Deputy Cheung Kin Chong said that in the US tariff increase scenario, Macau can take advantage of cargo transportation. “The international conjuncture of commerce has become more complicated and this will create profound changes to the context of MSAR. In the face of the new global trade conjuncture how can the role of Macao as a transport hub be used?” He asked. The chief executive pointed out that the “geographical location of Macau brings advantages” and referred to the expansion works of the airport and port in Hengqin, which will be “completed in two years”. "Our wish is to increase the airport's capacity and have more international flights. We will see the advantages of the resources Zhuhai has, because we want to take advantage of the synergies with the port of Hengqin," he said. Land | Sam says he can't plan “10 or 20 years” The need to better take advantage of landless land attributed was one of the points developed yesterday in the debate between deputies and chief executive about the government line report for this year. However, Sam Hou Fai admitted not being able to "give an answer to planning for 10 or 20 years." "Let us think of the purpose of each land taking into account the directing plan, and if necessary we can change the purposes already defined," he said, adding that, to date, 85 land with an area of ​​108 square kilometers were recovered by the administration, and 200,000 hectares used. “We always have to have some landless land for the construction of industrial parks and research spaces,” said Sam Hou Fai, who in the debate left some ideas for the future reuse of the coastal zones of the territory. “We can think of plans for the terrain of the former Macau Jockey Club, and we have a large land, very close to the airport, which was thought to intermediate housing, but can be affectionate to technological development. We also need facilities for the tourism and culture sector, such as the bar or with the Ocean Garden. A marginal corridor that can host cultural activities and exhibitions in order to articulate with a more contemporary development, ”he said.

item.title: LAG 2025 | New childhood subsidy will benefit 15 thousand children
item.description: One of the novelties of the Governing Action Lines Report (LAG) for this year is the creation of the childhood allowance, which will benefit 15,000 children with a maximum of three years with 1,500 monthly patacas, ie 18,000 patacas per year. The number of beneficiaries was advanced yesterday by Sam Hou Fai, chief executive, in a debate in which the birth support measures were highlighted by the deputies. "In its first lag gave importance to the low birth rate, increasing subsidies. This is in accordance with society's demands," said Wong Kit Cheng. However, the deputy recalled that it is necessary to give more support to families, "because there is great economic pressure, where couples care about the lack of time," a scenario that "leads to less desire to have children." "It should study favorable measures to the family, such as tax reduction, housing support or the improvement of health care for women and children," he added. Sam Hou Fai has regretted the low birth rate in Macao and said that, in recent years, several supports have been given, namely in day care centers. “According to our data, 240 million patacas of Patacas are granted to day care centers, which gives an average of 34,000 patacas per child. For the most vulnerable families we have free vacancies, about 900.” Schools in Apuros Who also talked about the low birth in line with the educational sector was Deputy Ma Io Fong, who mentioned "the classes with less students", also denouncing "many schools already use their own savings to face current expenses, and the number of employees need to be reduced." Thus, the deputy understands that the executive “must distribute rationally and invest more resources in education”. However, Sam Hou Fai pointed out that a lot of money from the public purse in the educational area is already spent. “There are large recurring expenses and Macau spends many resources on education. We give subsidies taking into account the number of students per class, and this year the budget for the educational fund is 9.6 billion of patacas. Education expenses occupy the first place on the current expenses list.” The ruler also promised to "help schools in a vulnerable situation," but recalling that "private schools are mostly and have autonomy."

item.title: COVER CLASS | Sam hu fai expects “consensus” to decide
item.description:
There may be changes in the pecuniary reimbursement program, but it is not known when or how. Sam Hou Fai said it was necessary more consensus in society, but indicated that part of the budget value for the check can be applied to the local economy
The pecuniary reimbursement program will be changed, but Sam Hou Fai was no use yesterday, at the Press Conference on the Governing Action Lines Report (LAG) for this year, no details on what this change will be, regarding formats, values ​​and if residents living outside Macao will continue to receive support. In order to know what will happen is necessary consensus, he said. "I can't respond more detailed about the [check assignment] conditions. At this time, the government's goal is to give 10,000 patacas to permanent residents and 6,000 for non-permanent. For more details I have to have the consensus of society," he said. Sam Hou Fai left, however, some considerations about any formats to be adopted by the authorities. "We have been this plan for 17 years, and if we keep it in old format, or if it will be necessary to reform, it depends on the consensus we get in society. We can deposit the money in the bank or use a certain amount to inject the economy, so that it will be more dependent on the real life situation." The chief executive pointed out that, in budgetary terms, “this year will not be easy”, as “very high regular expenses, of 150 billion, and tax revenues of the game of the order of 93.1 billion are foreseen. In addition, the ruler recalled the highest stability of the current inflation rate in 2008, when the pecuniary reimbursement program was created. "I remember that in 2008 the financial crisis and the inflation rate were issues faced at the time. The inflation rate was 9.4 percent, but now it is more relieved. The pecuniary checks are a measure of support and not regulated by law. In society there have been voices that this plan has a part that is not fair and has to change," he said. “Because it is an annual measure, it is necessary to launch the administrative regulation, and if not released, it is a sign that there will be no cash checks. When I perform the regulation I will take into account the different social situations. I have only four months as chief executive and need to hear more opinions. If we keep the model of the ten thousand patacas is easy, because we have residents working in the large bay. 183 days, continue to have support. ” Dwelling Asked about the management of economic housing, Sam Hou Fai made it clear that the government will only complete the fractions that are under construction and suspend new projects, given the reduction of demand from residents. "There is a slowdown due to economic adjustment after pandemic and the price of housing in neighboring regions. Currently, ten thousand fractions are under construction, whose work ends in 2026, and the remaining projects are suspended. We will not plan to resume the works, because economic housing is something that is related to the supply of land and the private market. assured. Remembering the current international economic conjuncture, Sam Hou Fai said that "this is not the right time to decide the construction of more economic housing." Yes, there may be an adjustment so that families can change home depending on the needs. "We will study mechanisms so that households have other options. Singles can already have a family and need another type of house. We think more about families on waiting list, ensure a balance and ponder various situations," he said. Intermediate housing is not even mentioned in this lag report. "We do not mention this plan because of the economic situation of Macau, because it takes a balance between private housing, intermediate and economic. The demand for economic housing has lowered," he said. Taxis like “Mark Six” Regarding entry into the platform market like Uber or Chinese Didi, Sam Hou Fai promised to study “a platform to call taxis”, admitting the lack of offer on holidays and weekends. “During my campaign I talked to foreign trade chambers who told me that taking a taxi in Macau is as difficult as winning Mark Six. item.title: Embarrassed teachers
item.description: Teachers are study, knowledge, culture, dedication and suffering. There are no two equal teachers. Some female and others in the masculine. In Portugal we attend teachers, with children, to be placed 300 kilometers from home. To reach the teaching site and not have the minimum conditions of habitability. Teachers are the fundamental of the formation of our children. Many parents do not understand that the formation of their descendants has to do with teachers and that education has to be done within the family. Teachers must have been the professional class that was the most impaired and more manifestations of protest for many years. Their protests aimed to correct the situation of thousands of teachers who were surpassed in their career by colleagues with less time of service. Since 2018, about 50,000 teachers have not been properly repositioned, resulting in the placement of teachers with the same time of service at different echelons, due exclusively to legal norms. The teachers always stressed that they did not fight for more money, but for justice. There were teachers who were over 30 years old on the 10th level when they should have been placed in the seventh level. Last year, a gigantic demonstration with teachers from all over the country was held in Lisbon, at a meeting held by the National Federation of Teachers (FenProf) and leader Mário Nogueira argued that it was necessary to create a more attractive career that kept those still in schools and attracted young people and those who chose to abandon the profession ahead of time. Teachers through their representatives have gained some claims. However, schools remain places of great concern. Students have lost respect for teachers and there have been several cases of violence in which students assault teachers. It is not easy to be a teacher these days. However, last week the whole class of teachers must have been very embarrassed. And it's sad to know of embarrassed teachers. Why? Because it was disclosed on social networks that a teacher had an ignoble behavior of pure racism. The teacher, from very young students, asked everyone present in class to assert what they dreamed of their adulthood. The students were answering what they thought and when it came to a student with African roots, the teacher returned: "You, it is not worth talking because the so -called your color end up in alcohol and misery ...". There was a sepulchral silence in the classroom and the African kid got up and said: “The teacher is very mistaken. You will end in misery very first that I know that I was orphaned and was adopted by a very rich family, my grandparents are very rich and my parents are very rich and I am the grandson and the only child that I will receive several fortunes…”. This case has shocked many communities and many teachers have been embarrassed because it is inadmissible for a teacher to be racist to the point of being able to traumatize a student for the rest of his life. Racism exists, always existed. But a teacher cannot give such a negative example of the true training function in a classroom. Racism is fought for how many human and democratic rights argue. In Portugal we have an far right party with racist laivos. Possibly the teacher in question is electing this party. It is hardly believed that a teacher rejects the word of a "black" student just because he is "black" and tells him that he will end up in alcohol and misery like all "blacks". The teacher showed not having the least knowledge of the world around her or is really radical racist. We have millionaire Africans, lawyers, engineers, architects, doctors, journalists, deputies, leaders of large companies, police, all excellent and, fortunately, we have Portuguese of African origin in most professions. This teacher cannot continue to embarrass his colleagues. The teacher has to be the subject of a disciplinary process that aims to be expelled from the profession and the parents of the offended young man should move a criminal case against the teacher through court. This was a regrettable case and the question is: how many more similar cases will happen through schools across the country? Such a discrimination, so serious, should not go unpunished and the school principals must have the complete knowledge of what kind of teachers they have in their schools so they can end with inadmissible facts as we have reported. Ai, Portugal, Portugal… PS - In previous chronicle we wrote about the illegalities that took place in Portuguese prisons. Last week, the Judiciary Police carried out a mega operation in several arrests and two prison guards and a PSP agent were connoted with the entry of drugs and mobile phones in the prisons.

item.title: The psychology of attraction at first sight
item.description: "Attraction at first sight" is a phenomenon that fascinates everyone. The romantic comedies portray it as an instant and uncontrollable moment between two people. It is now necessary to unravel the possible explanations behind this phenomenon, resorting to two major schools of thought: cognitive psychology-which develops empirical methodologies to test hypotheses on the subject-and the psychodynamic approach-that works with interpretative bases. Both perspectives build metaphors that help us interpret these processes. Thus, we can oscillate between two proposals: will at first glance be a product of deeply rooted unconscious mechanisms or, on the contrary, a posteriori romantic construction, based on sensory and cognitive processes? Cognitive psychology suggests that "attraction at first sight" can result from rapid processing of sensory and emotional information. The human brain is programmed to recognize standards and categorize information efficiently, allowing us to evaluate someone in fractions of second, based on facial traits, expressions or body language. Studies on social perception confirm that we formulate immediate judgments about others. From a biological point of view, this phenomenon may be linked to activation of the dopaminergic system, responsible for the regulation of pleasure and reward. When we find someone we consider attractive, the brain releases dopamine, triggering a desire for proximity. In addition, investigation into pheromonas indicate that we are unconsciously attracted by partners whose immune system complements ours, favoring genetic diversity in descent. On the other hand, the psychodynamic approach, rooted in Sigmund Freud's psychoanalysis, explains the attraction at first sight through unconscious mechanisms. From this perspective, past experiences - especially those of childhood - shape our standards of attraction. When we feel instantly attracted to someone, it may be because this person acts memories or emotions associated with primary linking figures such as parents or caregivers. Attraction does not focus on the other as a real person, but in the way he resonates within our unconscious structure of desire. The other can symbolize something we lack, something interdict or an emotional issue not yet resolved. This mechanism, known as projective identification, explains how we can feel a strong attraction to someone who unconsciously represents significant parts of our psychic history. According to this theory, we rarely fall in love with those who really are, but by the way we project in it our unresolved emotional needs. The attraction is therefore a meeting of unconscious, where both project family standards in each other. Of course beliefs also shape romantic expectations. If we believe that instant attraction is a sign of destination, we tend to attribute to it emotional meaning. The impact of culture and social norms shows how the perception of “love at first sight” can be influenced by romanticed narratives. For example, in books, movies or advertising romanticizes the idea of ​​attraction at first glance, creating a narrative that leads people to idealize and expect intense and immediate emotional links. This cultural expectation can influence the way we interpret real encounters-if someone lives in tune with romantic ideals, it is more likely to attribute emotional meaning to an instant attraction, facing it as something "intended to happen" or "predestined". Cognitive psychology faces the phenomenon more pragmatically, almost stripping it of its romanticism: it all depends on our mental processing and what we consider relevant. Psychoanalysis, on the other hand, articulates the cross between fantasy and reality, proposing that although the attraction at first glance is composed of projective and fanciful elements, they are not totally dissociated from the meeting itself. There is something significant in this dynamic; Otherwise, people would not fall in love. As a psychoanalyst would say, we are attracted to those who can nourish our psychic wounds-which later may reveal the cause of dysfunctions in the couple. There is an intangible domain that subtly communicates who we are, where we have come from and how we can complete. In short, while neuroscience and cognitive psychology highlight automatic and hormonal reactions, psychodynamics emphasizes the role of unconscious and past experiences. Although cognitive and psychodynamic psychology can seem opposite-one focusing on conscious and observable processes and the other in unconscious and emotional mechanisms-there is potential for overlap, and recognizing it could make explanation more robust. The cognitive perspective on attraction, which emphasizes rapid and automatic judgments based on physical signals and emotional responses, can be understood as the initial and superficial processing that is complemented by unconscious processes. But my proposal is another: show that the way we look at the phenomenon affects the way we live it. Each explanation can better adapt to each person's experiences. Is the attraction at first glance rooted in an authentic and deep desire, or is it an illusion fueled by the human need for connection and meaning? The answer may reside in each other's imagination and wealth. Ultimately, the way we interpret the phenomenon of “attraction at first sight” can be deeply influenced by the brain and unconscious mechanisms discussed, but also by the cultural narratives we internalize. Thus, experience will always be an intersection between what we feel and how we learn to feel.

item.title: History | Book about Americans in Macao in the 19th century presented today
item.description:
The book “To the Farthest Gulf for the Wealth of India - Macao Representations in the Peabody Essex Museum (Salem)”, by Rogério Miguel Puga, tells the story of Americans who lived in Macao in the nineteenth century. The Academic today presents in the Portuguese Bookstore the work that resulted from consultation with records stored in a museum in Salem, in the state of Massachusetts
Macao has long been a place of trade and experiences of people from around the world. One of the foreign communities that lived in the territory, in the busy nineteenth century, consisted of Americans, whose presence in Macao lasted in photographs, diaries, objects and paintings, present at the Peabody Essex Museum, in Salem, Massachusetts. These signs of the ostentation of life, wealth and business that Americans had in the territory were the subject of analysis by Rogério Miguel Puga. The academic linked to New University of Lisbon launched, in 2023, a book that resulted from years of investigation into this theme, entitled “To the Farthest Gulf for the Wealth of India - Macao Representations at Peabody Essex Museum (Salem)”. The author presents today the work in Macau, from 18:30, in a session in the Portuguese Bookstore. At HM, it tells a little about the long course of research and writing, which was supported by the Macau Foundation. "I started the book in Macao in 2009, but only in 2023 was released. It makes perfect sense to present the book in the city that is the subject of the investigation and where it was started." The academic states that today's presentation in the Portuguese bookstore is “doubly symbolic” because there is a collaboration with Ciela, a research center of the University of Macau (one), where Rogério Miguel Puga has presented some lectures on the themes of the book, dynamized by professor Mário Pinharanda Nunes. Today's session at the Portuguese Bookstore is moderate by Joshua Erlich, a professor at UM, “who also conducts research on the East India Company in India, thus communicating his work with my study on the British presence in Macau between 1635 and 1793, already published,” said Rogério Miguel Puga. The author confesses that the event also symbolizes a return to a territory that has not visited since 2019 and where it always finds new topics to study. ” "This time, I focused on the Portuguese presence in Hong Kong, after visiting the exhibition 'Lusy Stories' at the Hong Kong Museum of History, which I will soon publish a reception in Portugal," he told HM. The book presented today has been for sale at the Plaza Cultural Macau Bookstore, SENG KWong Bookstore (Starlight Bookstore) and the Macau Foundation's public information center. Show Macau to the World What objects were these and what did they serve? What useful did you have for Americans travelers in a time of rare and difficult communications? At a time when Macau was the only gateway to China, which did not allow residence to foreigners, they landed here to do business. Then, arrived in the US, showed Macao they had known. Rogério Miguel Puga discovered this universe when he visited the museum in 2005. “I realized that in one of the museum rooms were several representations of Macau. I found the connection [from the territory] to Salem curious. It was a picture identified as Macau, but it was, in fact, a representation of Shanghai. and other artists, ”he said in an interview conducted in 2023. At the Salem Museum there are objects such as fans, fitting tables, table tops, portraits, sewing tables with macao representations or portraits commissioned by Americans. Rogério Miguel Puga writes not only about these objects, but also about the historical context of the time, having also conducted research in cities such as New York, Philadelphia and Washington. However, it also takes place today, between 2:45 pm and 4 pm, at the Faculty of Arts and Humanities, the lecture “Anglo-Portuguese Relations and the British Presence in Macau (18th-19th centuries)”, the theme in the book. This is a session where we talk a little about the history of these western traders looking for Macao to do business with China, especially from 1700, when the Eastern Indian Company establishes direct trade relations with the country. In the lecture will also be mentioned the social and cultural interconnections that have taken place in these years between foreign traders and local populations.

item.title: Rui Cunha Foundation hosts book launch on buildings life
item.description: The Docomomo Macau Research Center has launched an invitation to present the book “How to Extend Buildings Life”, which results from a Macao Docomomo investigation into the most significant examples of twentieth -century modern architecture. The event is scheduled for April 23, at 6.30 pm, at the Rui Cunha Foundation and will be attended by architects Cecilia Chu, Bernard Brennan and Rui Leão, in a conversation moderate by Francisco Ricarte. According to the organizers, the will be “aiming to lead the importance of modern movement to public attention, authorities, professionals and the educational community concerned with the built environment, and promote the development of adequate conservation techniques and methods and disseminate this knowledge among the professions”. Throughout the conversation it will also be addressed the conservation of architectural heritage, which, according to the organizers, has as its background the increasingly intense threats. "In recent decades, the architectural heritage of the last century seemed more threatened than in any other period. This is mainly due to the fact that many of these masterpieces are not considered elements of heritage, their original functions changed substantially and their technological innovations did not always resist long-term tensions," he was communicated. "Once functional use can change over time, well -designed buildings are able to adapt to new types of use and prolong their usefulness when their durability goes beyond the role of their original tenant," he was added. Intervention voices Regarding speakers, Cecilia Chu is an associate professor at the School of Architecture at the Chinese University of Hong Kong, graduated in Urban History and with experience in design and conservation. Bernard Brennan is an associate of Wilkinson Eyre and assistant professor at the Faculty of Architecture at the University of Hong Kong (HKU). As a professional architect, he worked on a wide range of adaptive reuse projects in historical scenarios, recently including the state of State Theater in Hong Kong. In turn, Rui Leão is an architect whose practice covers architecture and urban planning projects, especially in Macau. It works in the teaching of architecture and in editorial works related to the areas of heritage and urbanism. He has a degree in Architecture from the Faculty of Architecture of Faup Porto, Portugal, in 1993, and has a doctorate in Architecture and Urbanism from RMIT, the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology, Australia.
